metadata.title: CVE-2023-51385 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In ssh in OpenSSH before 9.6, OS command injection might occur if a username or host name has shell metacharacters, and this name is referenced byan expansion token in certain situations. For example, an untrusted Gitrepository can have a submodule with shell metacharacters in a user name orhost name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
openssh-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
openssh-sftp-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
openssh-tests - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
ssh - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.6').
openssh-ssh1 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
